extendedIngredients.name: canned tomatoes

title: Pancho Villa Baked Tilapia
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Pancho Villa Baked Tilapian a try. This recipe makes 4 servings with 337 calories, 48g of protein, and 11g of fat each. For $4.63 per serving, this recipe covers 29% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. If you have fillets tilapia, juice of lime, lime, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the lime you could follow this main course with the Lime Angel Food Cake with Lime Glaze and Pistachios as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 35 minutes. It is brought to you by Allrecipes. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 88%, which is great. Similar recipes include Pancho Villa Baked Tilapia, Pancho’s Pico De Gallo, and Villa Valentina's potato gnocchi.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Mark West Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mark West Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description:
Crisp and clean, this wine features honeydew, stone fruit, and citrus with a subtle, clean, lingering finish.
Try pairing with good old fish and chips, summer salads, and steamed clams by the dozen...or dozens.

instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat one side of 4 (8x10 inch) pieces of aluminum foil with olive oil.                            Center each fillet on a foil square. Spoon a generous amount of diced tomatoes with juices over fish. Sprinkle with lime juice and cilantro. Position 2 slices of lime on top of each fillet. Close and seal foil packets, and place on a baking tray.                            Bake in preheated oven for approximately 20 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat one side of 4 (8x10 inch) pieces of aluminum foil with olive oil.
Center each fillet on a foil square. Spoon a generous amount of diced tomatoes with juices over fish.
Sprinkle with lime juice and cilantro. Position 2 slices of lime on top of each fillet. Close and seal foil packets, and place on a baking tray.
Bake in preheated oven for approximately 20 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
